captions.text: It’s a very special occasion for our lads.
To get a European experience, to see the Inter first team play on Sunday evening,
to train at their training ground and to play against their academy side.
Luke in goal, Curtis right back, Trey, Jose, Kamal
Callum four, Abou eight, Benjamin ten, DJ plays the right.
Bilal, you play the left to start with. Pedro, down the middle.
We’ve been to watch the first team play, got some ideas on set-pieces with video clips that Jack has put together.
So we probably have a little more insight into what’s likely to happen than we would for most matches,
where we’re not quite sure of the strength of the opposition when we turn up.
There was nothing in the video that we saw that you should be intimidated by, OK?
It’s going to come down to set-pieces, free-kicks, our understanding of our game tactics.
We watched the first team play. They play three at the back: a 3-5-2, yeah?
If they do play a three, our joy is not centrally, but wide.
Our wide players have to be outside the centre-halves.
A lot of responsibility is on Bilal, DJ, and full-backs.
The aim is to pull their wing backs back so they end up playing with a back five, and then we’ve got our full-backs that can push on.
I would say the most important time for my career was from 15 to 18.
I think that’s when I was developing most and when I started to realise I have to be professional.
I have to give more and I have to train more.
You have to work hard, you have to give yourself 100% if you want to succeed.
Not just in football, in anything.
I believe that they will play football on the floor,
that they will not allow counter-attacks as much as maybe you’re going to get in other countries.
That’s how I find playing on a professional level.
We play high pressure, so we like to say ‘try to play out from the back’.
We’ll drop off a little bit and then we go ‘now we’re going to try and win it’, so we play quite high.
What will they do against us? Will they, say, will they just drop off?
I think when the goalkeeper has the ball they will try to stop us playing from the back. OK.
Nemanja has given us a few tips on possibly how they’re going to play. Hopefully we’ve given the guys the right tools now.
The most important thing for us is that we really deliver and show what we’re capable of.
We know Inter scouts will be watching the game, feeding back to us their thoughts on the players.
Hopefully if one or two shine, who knows what opportunities may come ahead.
Just think back to before you joined this academy, and think about all the guys that want to get into this academy
and there’s thousands of them.
What today is all about: these opportunities come along, for us as staff, as well as you as players maybe once in a lifetime.
You’re playing on Inter Milan’s training ground against Inter Milan players.
All our preparation leading into this game is about the next 90 minutes.
Back in early! Defend it! Time!
Don’t let him switch! Don’t let them switch!
Go on Benjamin, go on Benjamin! Go on, you’re away you’re away!
Good boy, well done.
Get in!
Yes. Yes!
Guys, you did great. Only challenge is can you do the same again for the next 45: can you get a third, can you get a fourth?
OK? That’s the challenge for you guys. You’ve been excellent. Keep it going, alright?
Come on, same again.
Good save you.
Finish! Yes!
I mean tactically we were slightly unsure how they were going to play, so obviously the first team play a 3-5-2.
Nemanja Vidic said to us yesterday that possibly they’ll play a flat back four
so we prepared for both but I think where I was really pleased was that our shape imposed itself on them.
Bilal and DJ played quite wide. The relationship between Benjamin and Pedro was very good.
The relationship between Callum and Abou was excellent. We had a really good base from which to work
and I would reinforce set-pieces, you know, to score from two corners.
Jose has got on one and also Trey has scored with a header which is a really key part of the game as well.
So, all in all, tactically, we were on it.
We’ll fly high now so we feel like we can beat anyone after that performance.
Each and every game we’ve got to take it as the same and try to impress people and try to get in a professional environment.
I’d like to compliment the coaches and staff
because I saw an organised team
with a positive mentality.
I saw that they played without fear.
Four at the back with full backs pushing on
one striker with three wide attackers
and a mentality that was very attacking and proactive.
And for me this is the most important thing when developing young players.

title: Nike Academy: Internazionale Milano vs Nike Academy
